column5: Thanks, Stevie B I'll check it out, but now Allan D has got me thinking about Big Whiteshell. Wish I could be in two places at the same time.

Sorry, I was going for the trout lakes. Actually, I haven't fished Wellman either. I did try Line Lake a couple times last year in mid summer and caught one small muskie. "Hold on to the boat, boys, she's gonna ram us!"
Just wanted to know where is everybody going to be fishin' in Manitoba this coming weeekend.Fish ON!!
Reed Lake, May 23rd through about June 4th give or take a day either way, cant wait. Where is everybody else fishing Manitoba and when? Can't wait to catch another large toothy critter!Kilroy
The Ducks! Workin' on my ten species, seven more to go!
Big Whiteshell Lake is going to be the place to be. The river flowing between Lone Island Lake and Little Whiteshell.Alan D
I'm going to Lac du Bonnet this Sunday. I've only fished it once last year. Anyone have any idea where the main spawning area is?
Headed out to Athapap June 16 for lakers & walleyes.Hopefully the big part is off.Just bought a new Lund MR.Pike 18/135 opti & can't wait to try it!

Opening? probably setting up on Reed lake and do some walleye and laker fishing,then from there all summer to fish all the lakes around that area even hopefully hit Athapap.All the lakes should be open by the longweekend in May,they are not far off now.FISH ON!

Bobby, where you going in the Ducks? Going up end of May,is Veral lake or Wellman lake better for walleye? Wellman lake is large any tips on where to find them. Is pickeral bay a good location?I love all the trout lakes but I'd like to catch some walleye and pike any help would be great. thanks

They do have a spaning ground at the mouth of the Lee River. The local's refer to it as Willow Point. I haven't been there for a few years. I do believe that there are some date restrictions to fishing near the spaning area. So check with the regulations and the locals. Good luck!Fish ON!!
